newsitem.title: USA: Midwest Express December load factor up.
newsitem.headline: Midwest Express December load factor up.

text.p: Midwest Express Holdings Inc said Friday passenger load factor in December for its Midwest Express Airlines rose two points to 62.8 percent from 60.8 percent a year ago.
December load factor for Skyway Airlines gained 3.6 points to 41.4 percent from 37.8 percent.

Revenue passenger miles in December rose 15.8 percent to 103.9 million for Midwest Express and gained 10.4 percent to 5.1 million for Skyway. Available seat miles in the month for increased 12.2 percent to 165.4 million for Midwest Express and rose 0.8 percent to 12.3 million for Skyway.

"December was another good month for Midwest Express," Timothy Hoeksema, chairman, said in a statement. "We recorded a 15.8 percent increase in traffic on a 12.2 percent increase in capacity -- thanks in part to the post-Thanksgiving rush, which took place in December this year."
For all of 1996, Midwest Express' passenger load factor dropped 0.6 points to 63.5 percent from 64.1 percent in 1995. Skyway's 1996 load factor rose 1.8 points to 44.3 percent from 42.5 percent.
The company said Midwest Express' load factor for the year dropped due to new service added in May and September, which increased capacity but resulted in the decline in load factor.

Midwest Express' revenue passsenger miles for the year rose 7.8 percent to 1.24 billion and Skyway's gained 7.2 percent to 71.2 million. Available seat miles for the year for Midwest Express rose 8.9 percent to 1.95 billion and for Skyway gained 2.8 percent to 160.5 million.

He said both Midwest Express and the industry benefited from strong demand and overall favorable yields throughout the year. At the same time, fuel prices for Midwest Express increased 24 percent year over year.
